2687static cata::optional<tripoint> nearest_passable( const tripoint &p, const tripoint &closest_to )
2688{
2689 map &here = get_map();
2690 if( here.passable( p ) ) {
2691 return p;
2692 }
2693
2694 // We need to path to adjacent tile, not the exact one
2695 // Let's pick the closest one to us that is passable
2696 std::vector<tripoint> candidates = closest_points_first( p, 1 );
2697 std::sort( candidates.begin(), candidates.end(), [ closest_to ]( const tripoint & l,
2698 const tripoint & r ) {
2699 return rl_dist( closest_to, l ) < rl_dist( closest_to, r );
2700 } );
2701 auto iter = std::find_if( candidates.begin(), candidates.end(), [&here, &p]( const tripoint & pt ) {
2702 return here.passable( pt ) && !here.obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( p, pt );
2703 } );
2704 if( iter != candidates.end() ) {
2705 return *iter;
2706 }
2707
2708 return cata::nullopt;
2709}
2710
2711void npc::move_away_from( const std::vector<sphere> &spheres, bool no_bashing )
2712{
2713 if( spheres.empty() ) {
2714 return;
2715 }
2716
2717 tripoint minp( pos() );
2718 tripoint maxp( pos() );
2719
2720 for( const auto &elem : spheres ) {
2721 minp.x = std::min( minp.x, elem.center.x - elem.radius );
2722 minp.y = std::min( minp.y, elem.center.y - elem.radius );
2723 maxp.x = std::max( maxp.x, elem.center.x + elem.radius );
2724 maxp.y = std::max( maxp.y, elem.center.y + elem.radius );
2725 }
2726
2727 const tripoint_range<tripoint> range( minp, maxp );
2728
2729 std::vector<tripoint> escape_points;
2730
2731 map &here = get_map();
2732 std::copy_if( range.begin(), range.end(), std::back_inserter( escape_points ),
2733 [&here]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2734 return here.passable( elem );
2735 } );
2736
2737 cata::sort_by_rating( escape_points.begin(), escape_points.end(), [&]( const tripoint & elem ) {
2738 const int danger = std::accumulate( spheres.begin(), spheres.end(), 0,
2739 [&]( const int sum, const sphere & s ) {
2740 return sum + std::max( s.radius - rl_dist( elem, s.center ), 0 );
2741 } );
2742
2743 const int distance = rl_dist( pos(), elem );
2744 const int move_cost = here.move_cost( elem );
2745
2746 return std::make_tuple( danger, distance, move_cost );
2747 } );
2748
2749 for( const auto &elem : escape_points ) {
2750 update_path( elem, no_bashing );
2751
2752 if( elem == pos() || !path.empty() ) {
2753 break;
2754 }
2755 }
2756
2757 if( !path.empty() ) {
2758 move_to_next();
2759 } else {
2760 move_pause();
2761 }
2762}
2763
2764void npc::see_item_say_smth( const itype_id &object, const std::string &smth )
2765{
2766 map &here = get_map();
2767 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), 6 ) ) {
2768 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2769 for( const item &it : here.i_at( p ) ) {
2770 if( one_in( 100 ) && ( it.typeId() == object ) ) {
2771 say( smth );
2772 }
2773 }
2774 }
2775 }
2776}
2777
2778void npc::find_item()
2779{
2780 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2781 see_item_say_smth( itype_thorazine, "<no_to_thorazine>" );
2782 see_item_say_smth( itype_lsd, "<yes_to_lsd>" );
2783 return;
2784 }
2785
2786 if( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pick_up ) ) {
2787 // Grabbing stuff not allowed by our "owner"
2788 return;
2789 }
2790
2791 fetching_item = false;
2792 int best_value = minimum_item_value();
2793 // Not perfect, but has to mirror pickup code
2794 units::volume volume_allowed = volume_capacity() - volume_carried();
2795 units::mass weight_allowed = weight_capacity() - weight_carried();
2796 // For some reason range limiting by vision doesn't work properly
2797 const int range = 6;
2798 //int range = sight_range( g->light_level( posz() ) );
2799 //range = std::max( 1, std::min( 12, range ) );
2800
2801 static const zone_type_id zone_type_no_npc_pickup( "NO_NPC_PICKUP" );
2802
2803 const item *wanted = nullptr;
2804
2805 const bool whitelisting = has_item_whitelist();
2806
2807 if( volume_allowed <= 0_ml || weight_allowed <= 0_gram ) {
2808 return;
2809 }
2810
2811 const auto consider_item =
2812 [&wanted, &best_value, whitelisting, volume_allowed, weight_allowed, this]
2813 ( const item & it, const tripoint & p ) {
2814 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
2815 // Don't even consider liquids.
2816 return;
2817 }
2818 std::vector<npc *> followers;
2819 for( auto &elem : g->get_follower_list() ) {
2820 shared_ptr_fast<npc> npc_to_get = overmap_buffer.find_npc( elem );
2821 if( !npc_to_get ) {
2822 continue;
2823 }
2824 npc *npc_to_add = npc_to_get.get();
2825 followers.push_back( npc_to_add );
2826 }
2827 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
2828 for( auto &elem : followers ) {
2829 if( !it.is_owned_by( *this, true ) && ( player_character.sees( this->pos() ) ||
2830 player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos ) ||
2831 elem->sees( this->pos() ) || elem->sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2832 return;
2833 }
2834 }
2835 if( whitelisting && !item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
2836 return;
2837 }
2838
2839 // When using a whitelist, skip the value check
2840 // TODO: Whitelist hierarchy?
2841 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : value( it );
2842
2843 if( itval > best_value &&
2844 ( it.volume() <= volume_allowed && it.weight() <= weight_allowed ) ) {
2845 wanted_item_pos = p;
2846 wanted = &( it );
2847 best_value = itval;
2848 }
2849 };
2850
2851 map &here = get_map();
2852 // Harvest item doesn't exist, so we'll be checking by its name
2853 std::string wanted_name;
2854 const auto consider_terrain =
2855 [ this, whitelisting, volume_allowed, &wanted, &wanted_name, &here ]( const tripoint & p ) {
2856 // We only want to pick plants when there are no items to pick
2857 if( !whitelisting || wanted != nullptr || !wanted_name.empty() || volume_allowed < 250_ml ) {
2858 return;
2859 }
2860
2861 const auto &harvest = here.get_harvest_names( p );
2862 for( const auto &entry : harvest ) {
2863 if( item_name_whitelisted( entry ) ) {
2864 wanted_name = entry;
2865 wanted_item_pos = p;
2866 break;
2867 }
2868 }
2869 };
2870
2871 for( const tripoint &p : closest_points_first( pos(), range ) ) {
2872 // TODO: Make this sight check not overdraw nearby tiles
2873 // TODO: Optimize that zone check
2874 if( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_no_npc_pickup, p ) ) {
2875 continue;
2876 }
2877
2878 const tripoint abs_p = global_square_location() - pos() + p;
2879 const int prev_num_items = ai_cache.searched_tiles.get( abs_p, -1 );
2880 // Prefetch the number of items present so we can bail out if we already checked here.
2881 const map_stack m_stack = here.i_at( p );
2882 int num_items = m_stack.size();
2883 const optional_vpart_position vp = here.veh_at( p );
2884 if( vp ) {
2885 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2886 if( cargo ) {
2887 vehicle_stack v_stack = cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() );
2888 num_items += v_stack.size();
2889 }
2890 }
2891 if( prev_num_items == num_items ) {
2892 continue;
2893 }
2894 auto cache_tile = [this, &abs_p, num_items, &wanted]() {
2895 if( wanted == nullptr ) {
2896 ai_cache.searched_tiles.insert( 1000, abs_p, num_items );
2897 }
2898 };
2899 bool can_see = false;
2900 if( here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) && sees( p ) ) {
2901 can_see = true;
2902 for( const item &it : m_stack ) {
2903 consider_item( it, p );
2904 }
2905 }
2906
2907 // Not cached because it gets checked once and isn't expected to change.
2908 if( can_see || sees( p ) ) {
2909 can_see = true;
2910 consider_terrain( p );
2911 }
2912
2913 if( !vp || vp->vehicle().is_moving() || !( can_see || sees( p ) ) ) {
2914 cache_tile();
2915 continue;
2916 }
2917 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> cargo = vp.part_with_feature( VPFLAG_CARGO, true );
2918 static const std::string locked_string( "LOCKED" );
2919 // TODO: Let player know what parts are safe from NPC thieves
2920 if( !cargo || cargo->has_feature( locked_string ) ) {
2921 cache_tile();
2922 continue;
2923 }
2924
2925 static const std::string cargo_locking_string( "CARGO_LOCKING" );
2926 if( vp.part_with_feature( cargo_locking_string, true ) ) {
2927 cache_tile();
2928 continue;
2929 }
2930
2931 for( const item &it : cargo->vehicle().get_items( cargo->part_index() ) ) {
2932 consider_item( it, p );
2933 }
2934 cache_tile();
2935 }
2936
2937 if( wanted != nullptr ) {
2938 wanted_name = wanted->tname();
2939 }
2940
2941 if( wanted_name.empty() ) {
2942 return;
2943 }
2944
2945 fetching_item = true;
2946
2947 // TODO: Move that check above, make it multi-target pathing and use it
2948 // to limit tiles available for choice of items
2949 const int dist_to_item = rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() );
2950 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2951 update_path( *dest );
2952 }
2953
2954 if( path.empty() && dist_to_item > 1 ) {
2955 // Item not reachable, let's just totally give up for now
2956 fetching_item = false;
2957 }
2958
2959 if( fetching_item && rl_dist( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) > 1 && is_walking_with() ) {
2960 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pick up that %s." ), wanted_name );
2961 }
2962}
2963
2964void npc::pick_up_item()
2965{
2966 if( is_hallucination() ) {
2967 return;
2968 }
2969
2970 if( !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pick_up ) && is_player_ally() ) {
2971 add_msg( m_debug, "%s::pick_up_item(); Canceling on player's request", name );
2972 fetching_item = false;
2973 moves -= 1;
2974 return;
2975 }
2976
2977 map &here = get_map();
2978 const cata::optional<vpart_reference> vp = here.veh_at( wanted_item_pos ).part_with_feature(
2979 VPFLAG_CARGO, false );
2980 const bool has_cargo = vp && !vp->has_feature( "LOCKED" );
2981
2982 if( ( !here.has_items( wanted_item_pos ) && !has_cargo &&
2983 !here.is_harvestable( wanted_item_pos ) && sees( wanted_item_pos ) ) ||
2984 ( is_player_ally() && g->check_zone( zone_type_id( "NO_NPC_PICKUP" ), wanted_item_pos ) ) ) {
2985 // Items we wanted no longer exist and we can see it
2986 // Or player who is leading us doesn't want us to pick it up
2987 fetching_item = false;
2988 move_pause();
2989 add_msg( m_debug, "Canceling pickup - no items or new zone" );
2990 return;
2991 }
2992
2993 add_msg( m_debug, "%s::pick_up_item(); [%d, %d, %d] => [%d, %d, %d]", name,
2994 posx(), posy(), posz(), wanted_item_pos.x, wanted_item_pos.y, wanted_item_pos.z );
2995 if( const cata::optional<tripoint> dest = nearest_passable( wanted_item_pos, pos() ) ) {
2996 update_path( *dest );
2997 }
2998
2999 const int dist_to_pickup = rl_dist( pos(), wanted_item_pos );
3000
3001 bool cant_reach = dist_to_pickup > 1 ||
3002 get_map().obstructed_by_vehicle_rotation( pos(), wanted_item_pos );
3003 if( cant_reach && !path.empty() ) {
3004 add_msg( m_debug, "Moving; [%d, %d, %d] => [%d, %d, %d]",
3005 posx(), posy(), posz(), path[0].x, path[0].y, path[0].z );
3006
3007 move_to_next();
3008 return;
3009 } else if( cant_reach && path.empty() ) {
3010 add_msg( m_debug, "Can't find path" );
3011 // This can happen, always do something
3012 fetching_item = false;
3013 move_pause();
3014 return;
3015 }
3016
3017 // We're adjacent to the item; grab it!
3018
3019 auto picked_up = pick_up_item_map( wanted_item_pos );
3020 if( picked_up.empty() && has_cargo ) {
3021 picked_up = pick_up_item_vehicle( vp->vehicle(), vp->part_index() );
3022 }
3023
3024 if( picked_up.empty() ) {
3025 // Last chance: plant harvest
3026 if( here.is_harvestable( wanted_item_pos ) ) {
3027 here.examine( *this, wanted_item_pos );
3028 // Note: we didn't actually pick up anything, just spawned items
3029 // but we want the item picker to find new items
3030 fetching_item = false;
3031 return;
3032 }
3033 }
3034 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3035 // Describe the pickup to the player
3036 bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( wanted_item_pos );
3037 if( u_see ) {
3038 if( picked_up.size() == 1 ) {
3039 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname() );
3040 } else if( picked_up.size() == 2 ) {
3041 add_msg( _( "%1$s picks up a %2$s and a %3$s." ), name, picked_up.front().tname(),
3042 picked_up.back().tname() );
3043 } else if( picked_up.size() > 2 ) {
3044 add_msg( _( "%s picks up several items." ), name );
3045 } else {
3046 add_msg( _( "%s looks around nervously, as if searching for something." ), name );
3047 }
3048 }
3049
3050 for( auto &it : picked_up ) {
3051 int itval = value( it );
3052 if( itval < worst_item_value ) {
3053 worst_item_value = itval;
3054 }
3055 i_add( it );
3056 }
3057
3058 moves -= 100;
3059 fetching_item = false;
3060 has_new_items = true;
3061}
3062
3063template <typename T>
3064std::list<item> npc_pickup_from_stack( npc &who, T &items )
3065{
3066 const bool whitelisting = who.has_item_whitelist();
3067 auto volume_allowed = who.volume_capacity() - who.volume_carried();
3068 auto weight_allowed = who.weight_capacity() - who.weight_carried();
3069 auto min_value = whitelisting ? 0 : who.minimum_item_value();
3070 std::list<item> picked_up;
3071
3072 for( auto iter = items.begin(); iter != items.end(); ) {
3073 const item &it = *iter;
3074 if( it.made_of( LIQUID ) ) {
3075 iter++;
3076 continue;
3077 }
3078
3079 if( whitelisting && !who.item_whitelisted( it ) ) {
3080 iter++;
3081 continue;
3082 }
3083
3084 auto volume = it.volume();
3085 if( volume > volume_allowed ) {
3086 iter++;
3087 continue;
3088 }
3089
3090 auto weight = it.weight();
3091 if( weight > weight_allowed ) {
3092 iter++;
3093 continue;
3094 }
3095
3096 int itval = whitelisting ? 1000 : who.value( it );
3097 if( itval < min_value ) {
3098 iter++;
3099 continue;
3100 }
3101
3102 volume_allowed -= volume;
3103 weight_allowed -= weight;
3104 picked_up.push_back( it );
3105 iter = items.erase( iter );
3106 }
3107
3108 return picked_up;
3109}
3110
3111std::list<item> npc::pick_up_item_map( const tripoint &where )
3112{
3113 map_stack stack = get_map().i_at( where );
3114 return npc_pickup_from_stack( *this, stack );
3115}
3116
3117std::list<item> npc::pick_up_item_vehicle( vehicle &veh, int part_index )
3118{
3119 auto stack = veh.get_items( part_index );
3120 return npc_pickup_from_stack( *this, stack );
3121}

3123// Used in npc::drop_items()
3124struct ratio_index {
3125 double ratio;
3126 int index;
3127 ratio_index( double R, int I ) : ratio( R ), index( I ) {}
3128};
3129
3130/* As of October 2019, this is buggy, do not use!! */
3131void npc::drop_items( units::mass drop_weight, units::volume drop_volume, int min_val )
3132{
3133 /* Remove this when someone debugs it back to functionality */
3134 return;
3135
3136 add_msg( m_debug, "%s is dropping items-%3.2f kg, %3.2f L (%d items, wgt %3.2f/%3.2f kg, "
3137 "vol %3.2f/%3.2f L)",
3138 name, units::to_kilogram( drop_weight ), units::to_liter( drop_volume ), inv.size(),
3139 units::to_kilogram( weight_carried() ), units::to_kilogram( weight_capacity() ),

3141
3142 units::mass weight_dropped = units::from_gram( 0 );
3143 units::volume volume_dropped = units::from_liter( 0 );
3144 std::vector<ratio_index> rWgt, rVol; // Weight/Volume to value ratios
3145

3147 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3148 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3149 item &it = slice[i]->front();

3152 if( value( it ) == 0 || value( it ) <= min_val ) {
3153 wgt_ratio = 99999;
3154 vol_ratio = 99999;
3155 } else {
3156 wgt_ratio = units::to_gram<double>( it.weight() ) / value( it );
3157 vol_ratio = units::to_liter( it.volume() / value( it ) );
3158 }
3159 bool added_wgt = false;
3160 bool added_vol = false;
3161 for( size_t j = 0; j < rWgt.size() && !added_wgt; j++ ) {
3162 if( wgt_ratio > rWgt[j].ratio ) {
3163 added_wgt = true;
3164 rWgt.insert( rWgt.begin() + j, ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3165 }
3166 }
3167 if( !added_wgt ) {
3168 rWgt.push_back( ratio_index( wgt_ratio, i ) );
3169 }
3170 for( size_t j = 0; j < rVol.size() && !added_vol; j++ ) {
3171 if( vol_ratio > rVol[j].ratio ) {
3172 added_vol = true;
3173 rVol.insert( rVol.begin() + j, ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3174 }
3175 }
3176 if( !added_vol ) {
3177 rVol.push_back( ratio_index( vol_ratio, i ) );
3178 }
3179 }
3180
3181 map &here = get_map();
3182 std::string item_name; // For description below
3183 int num_items_dropped = 0; // For description below
3184 // Now, drop items, starting from the top of each list
3185 while( weight_dropped < drop_weight || volume_dropped < drop_volume ) {
3186 // weight and volume may be passed as 0 or a negative value, to indicate that
3187 // decreasing that variable is not important.
3188 int dWeight = units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3189 units::to_gram<int>( drop_weight - weight_dropped ) / 250;
3190 int dVolume = units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume ) <= 0 ? -1 :
3191 units::to_milliliter<int>( drop_volume - volume_dropped ) / 250;
3192 int index;
3193 // Which is more important, weight or volume?
3194 if( dWeight > dVolume ) {
3195 index = rWgt[0].index;
3196 rWgt.erase( rWgt.begin() );
3197 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3198 for( auto &elem : rWgt ) {
3199 if( elem.index > index ) {
3200 elem.index--;
3201 }
3202 }
3203 } else {
3204 index = rVol[0].index;
3205 rVol.erase( rVol.begin() );
3206 // Fix the rest of those indices.
3207 for( size_t i = 0; i < rVol.size(); i++ ) {
3208 if( i > rVol.size() ) {
3209 debugmsg( "npc::drop_items() - looping through rVol - Size is %d, i is %d",
3210 rVol.size(), i );
3211 }
3212 if( rVol[i].index > index ) {
3213 rVol[i].index--;
3214 }
3215 }
3216 }
3217 weight_dropped += slice[index]->front().weight();
3218 volume_dropped += slice[index]->front().volume();
3219 item dropped = i_rem( index );
3220 num_items_dropped++;
3221 if( num_items_dropped == 1 ) {
3222 item_name += dropped.tname();
3223 } else if( num_items_dropped == 2 ) {
3224 item_name += _( " and " ) + dropped.tname();
3225 }
3226 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't drop real items
3227 here.add_item_or_charges( pos(), dropped );
3228 }
3229 }
3230 // Finally, describe the action if u can see it
3231 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3232 if( num_items_dropped >= 3 ) {
3233 add_msg( vgettext( "%s drops %d item.", "%s drops %d items.", num_items_dropped ), name,
3234 num_items_dropped );
3235 } else {
3236 add_msg( _( "%1$s drops a %2$s." ), name, item_name );
3237 }
3238 }
3239 update_worst_item_value();
3240}
3241
3242bool npc::find_corpse_to_pulp()
3243{
3244 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3245 if( ( is_player_ally() && ( !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_pulp ) ||
3246 player_character.in_vehicle ) ) ||
3247 is_hallucination() ) {
3248 return false;
3249 }
3250
3251 map &here = get_map();
3252 // Pathing with overdraw can get expensive, limit it
3253 int path_counter = 4;
3254 const auto check_tile = [this, &path_counter, &here]( const tripoint & p ) -> const item * {
3255 if( !here.sees_some_items( p, *this ) || !sees( p ) )
3256 {
3257 return nullptr;
3258 }
3259
3260 const map_stack items = here.i_at( p );
3261 const item *found = nullptr;
3262 for( const item &it : items )
3263 {
3264 // Pulp only stuff that revives, but don't pulp acid stuff
3265 // That is, if you aren't protected from this stuff!
3266 if( it.can_revive() ) {
3267 // If the first encountered corpse bleeds something dangerous then
3268 // it is not safe to bash.
3269 if( is_dangerous_field( field_entry( it.get_mtype()->bloodType(), 1, 0_turns ) ) ) {
3270 return nullptr;
3271 }
3272
3273 found = &it;
3274 break;
3275 }
3276 }
3277
3278 if( found != nullptr )
3279 {
3280 path_counter--;
3281 // Only return corpses we can path to
3282 return update_path( p, false, false ) ? found : nullptr;
3283 }
3284
3285 return nullptr;
3286 };
3287
3288 const int range = 6;
3289
3290 const item *corpse = nullptr;
3291 if( pulp_location && square_dist( pos(), *pulp_location ) <= range ) {
3292 corpse = check_tile( *pulp_location );
3293 }
3294
3295 // Find the old target to avoid spamming
3296 const item *old_target = corpse;
3297
3298 if( corpse == nullptr ) {
3299 // If we're following the player, don't wander off to pulp corpses
3300 const tripoint &around = is_walking_with() ? player_character.pos() : pos();
3301 for( const item_location &location : here.get_active_items_in_radius( around, range,
3302 special_item_type::corpse ) ) {
3303 corpse = check_tile( location.position() );
3304
3305 if( corpse != nullptr ) {
3306 pulp_location.emplace( location.position() );
3307 break;
3308 }
3309
3310 if( path_counter <= 0 ) {
3311 break;
3312 }
3313 }
3314 }
3315
3316 if( corpse != nullptr && corpse != old_target && is_walking_with() ) {
3317 say( _( "Hold on, I want to pulp that %s." ), corpse->tname() );
3318 }
3319
3320 return corpse != nullptr;
3321}
3322
3323bool npc::do_pulp()
3324{
3325 if( !pulp_location ) {
3326 return false;
3327 }
3328
3329 if( rl_dist( *pulp_location, pos() ) > 1 || pulp_location->z != posz() ) {
3330 return false;
3331 }
3332 // TODO: Don't recreate the activity every time
3333 int old_moves = moves;
3334 assign_activity( ACT_PULP, calendar::INDEFINITELY_LONG, 0 );
3335 activity.placement = get_map().getabs( *pulp_location );
3336 activity.do_turn( *this );
3337 return moves != old_moves;
3338}
3339
3340bool npc::do_player_activity()
3341{
3342 int old_moves = moves;
3343 if( moves > 200 && activity && ( activity.is_multi_type() ||
3344 activity.id() == activity_id( "ACT_TIDY_UP" ) ) ) {
3345 // a huge backlog of a multi-activity type can forever loop
3346 // instead; just scan the map ONCE for a task to do, and if it returns false
3347 // then stop scanning, abandon the activity, and kill the backlog of moves.
3348 if( !generic_multi_activity_handler( activity, *this->as_player(), true ) ) {
3349 revert_after_activity();
3350 set_moves( 0 );
3351 return true;
3352 }
3353 }
3354 // the multi-activity types can sometimes cancel the activity, and return without using up any moves.
3355 // ( when they are setting a destination etc. )
3356 // normally this isn't a problem, but in the main game loop, if the NPC has a huge backlog of moves;
3357 // then each of these occurrences will nudge the infinite loop counter up by one.
3358 // ( even if other move-using things occur inbetween )
3359 // so here - if no moves are used in a multi-type activity do_turn(), then subtract a nominal amount
3360 // to satisfy the infinite loop counter.
3361 const bool multi_type = activity ? activity.is_multi_type() : false;
3362 const int moves_before = moves;
3363 while( moves > 0 && activity ) {
3364 activity.do_turn( *this );
3365 if( !is_active() ) {
3366 return true;
3367 }
3368 }
3369 if( multi_type && moves == moves_before ) {
3370 moves -= 1;
3371 }
3372 /* if the activity is finished, grab any backlog or change the mission */
3373 if( !has_destination() && !activity ) {
3374 if( !backlog.empty() ) {
3375 activity = backlog.front();
3376 backlog.pop_front();
3377 current_activity_id = activity.id();
3378 } else {
3379 if( is_player_ally() ) {
3380 add_msg( m_info, string_format( "%s completed the assigned task.", disp_name() ) );
3381 }
3382 current_activity_id = activity_id::NULL_ID();
3383 revert_after_activity();
3384 // if we loaded after being out of the bubble for a while, we might have more
3385 // moves than we need, so clear them
3386 set_moves( 0 );
3387 }
3388 }
3389 return moves != old_moves;
3390}
3391
3392bool npc::wield_better_weapon()
3393{
3394 // TODO: Allow wielding weaker weapons against weaker targets
3395 bool can_use_gun = ( !is_player_ally() || rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_guns ) );
3396 bool use_silent = ( is_player_ally() && rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_silent ) );
3397 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3398
3399 // Check if there's something better to wield
3400 item *best = &weapon;
3401 double best_value = -100.0;
3402
3403 const int ups_charges = charges_of( itype_UPS );
3404
3405 const auto compare_weapon =
3406 [this, &best, &best_value, ups_charges, can_use_gun, use_silent]( const item & it ) {
3407 bool allowed = can_use_gun && it.is_gun() && ( !use_silent || it.is_silent() );
3408 double val;
3409 if( !allowed ) {
3410 val = npc_ai::weapon_value( *this, it, 0 );
3411 } else {
3412 int ammo_count = it.ammo_remaining();
3413 int ups_drain = it.get_gun_ups_drain();
3414 if( ups_drain > 0 ) {
3415 ammo_count = std::min( ammo_count, ups_charges / ups_drain );
3416 }
3417
3418 val = npc_ai::weapon_value( *this, it, ammo_count );
3419 }
3420
3421 if( val > best_value ) {
3422 best = const_cast<item *>( &it );
3423 best_value = val;
3424 }
3425 };
3426
3427 compare_weapon( weapon );
3428 // To prevent changing to barely better stuff
3429 best_value *= std::max<float>( 1.0f, ai_cache.danger_assessment / 10.0f );
3430
3431 // Fists aren't checked below
3432 compare_weapon( null_item_reference() );
3433
3434 visit_items( [&compare_weapon, this]( item * node ) {
3435 // Only compare melee weapons, guns, or holstered items
3436 if( node->is_melee() || node->is_gun() ) {
3437 compare_weapon( *node );
3438 } else if( node->get_use( "holster" ) && !node->contents.empty() && node != &weapon ) {
3439 // TODO: special case for "wield from wielded holster"
3440 const item &holstered = node->get_contained();
3441 if( holstered.is_melee() || holstered.is_gun() ) {
3442 compare_weapon( holstered );
3443 }
3444 }
3445 return VisitResponse::SKIP;
3446 } );
3447
3448 // TODO: Reimplement switching to empty guns
3449 // Needs to check reload speed, RELOAD_ONE etc.
3450 // Until then, the NPCs should reload the guns as a last resort
3451
3452 if( best == &weapon ) {
3453 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielded %s is best at %.1f, not switching", best->type->get_id().str(),
3454 best_value );
3455 return false;
3456 }
3457
3458 add_msg( m_debug, "Wielding %s at value %.1f", best->type->get_id().str(), best_value );
3459
3460 wield( *best );
3461 return true;
3462}
3463
3464bool npc::scan_new_items()
3465{
3466 add_msg( m_debug, "%s scanning new items", name );
3467 if( wield_better_weapon() ) {
3468 return true;
3469 } else {
3470 // Stop "having new items" when you no longer do anything with them
3471 has_new_items = false;
3472 }
3473
3474 return false;
3475 // TODO: Armor?
3476}
3477
3478static void npc_throw( npc &np, item &it, int index, const tripoint &pos )
3479{
3480 if( get_player_character().sees( np ) ) {
3481 add_msg( _( "%1$s throws a %2$s." ), np.name, it.tname() );
3482 }
3483
3484 int stack_size = -1;
3485 if( it.count_by_charges() ) {
3486 stack_size = it.charges;
3487 it.charges = 1;
3488 }
3489 if( !np.is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations only pretend to throw
3490 ranged::throw_item( np, pos, it, cata::nullopt );
3491 }
3492 // Throw a single charge of a stacking object.
3493 if( stack_size == -1 || stack_size == 1 ) {
3494 np.i_rem( index );
3495 } else {
3496 it.charges = stack_size - 1;
3497 }
3498}
3499
3500bool npc::alt_attack()
3501{
3502 if( ( is_player_ally() && !rules.has_flag( ally_rule::use_grenades ) ) || is_hallucination() ) {
3503 return false;
3504 }
3505
3506 Creature *critter = current_target();
3507 if( critter == nullptr ) {
3508 // This function shouldn't be called...
3509 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() called with no target" );
3510 move_pause();
3511 return false;
3512 }
3513
3514 tripoint tar = critter->pos();
3515
3516 const int dist = rl_dist( pos(), tar );
3517 item *used = nullptr;
3518 // Remember if we have an item that is dangerous to hold
3519 bool used_dangerous = false;
3520
3521 static const std::string danger_string( "NPC_THROW_NOW" );
3522 static const std::string alt_string( "NPC_ALT_ATTACK" );
3523 // TODO: The active bomb with shortest fuse should be thrown first
3524 const auto check_alt_item = [&used, &used_dangerous, dist, this]( item & it ) {
3525 const bool dangerous = it.has_flag( danger_string );
3526 if( !dangerous && used_dangerous ) {
3527 return;
3528 }
3529
3530 // Not alt attack
3531 if( !dangerous && !it.has_flag( alt_string ) ) {
3532 return;
3533 }
3534
3535 // TODO: Non-thrown alt items
3536 if( !dangerous && throw_range( it ) < dist ) {
3537 return;
3538 }
3539
3540 // Low priority items
3541 if( !dangerous && used != nullptr ) {
3542 return;
3543 }
3544
3545 used = &it;
3546 used_dangerous = used_dangerous || dangerous;
3547 };
3548
3549 check_alt_item( weapon );
3550 for( auto &sl : inv.slice() ) {
3551 // TODO: Cached values - an itype slot maybe?
3552 check_alt_item( sl->front() );
3553 }
3554
3555 if( used == nullptr ) {
3556 return false;
3557 }
3558
3559 int weapon_index = get_item_position( used );
3560 if( weapon_index == INT_MIN ) {
3561 debugmsg( "npc::alt_attack() couldn't find expected item %s", used->tname() );
3562 return false;
3563 }
3564
3565 // Are we going to throw this item?
3566 if( !used->active && used->has_flag( "NPC_ACTIVATE" ) ) {
3567 activate_item( weapon_index );
3568 // Note: intentional lack of return here
3569 // We want to ignore player-centric rules to avoid carrying live explosives
3570 // TODO: Non-grenades
3571 }
3572
3573 // We are throwing it!
3574 int conf = confident_throw_range( *used, critter );
3575 const bool wont_hit = wont_hit_friend( tar, *used, true );
3576 if( dist <= conf && wont_hit ) {
3577 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3578 return true;
3579 }
3580
3581 if( wont_hit ) {
3582 // Within this block, our chosen target is outside of our range
3583 update_path( tar );
3584 move_to_next(); // Move towards the target
3585 }
3586
3587 // Danger of friendly fire
3588 if( !wont_hit && !used_dangerous ) {
3589 // Safe to hold on to, for now
3590 // Maneuver around player
3591 avoid_friendly_fire();
3592 return true;
3593 }
3594
3595 map &here = get_map();
3596 // We need to throw this live (grenade, etc) NOW! Pick another target?
3597 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3598 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3599 const monster *const target_ptr = g->critter_at<monster>( pt );
3600 int newdist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3601 // TODO: Change "newdist >= 2" to "newdist >= safe_distance(used)"
3602 if( newdist <= conf && newdist >= 2 && target_ptr &&
3603 wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3604 // Friendlyfire-safe!
3605 ai_cache.target = g->shared_from( *target_ptr );
3606 if( !one_in( 100 ) ) {
3607 // Just to prevent infinite loops...
3608 if( alt_attack() ) {
3609 return true;
3610 }
3611 }
3612 return false;
3613 }
3614 }
3615 }
3616 /* If we have reached THIS point, there's no acceptable monster to throw our
3617 * grenade or whatever at. Since it's about to go off in our hands, better to
3618 * just chuck it as far away as possible--while being friendly-safe.
3619 */
3620 int best_dist = 0;
3621 for( int dist = 2; dist <= conf; dist++ ) {
3622 for( const tripoint &pt : here.points_in_radius( pos(), dist ) ) {
3623 int new_dist = rl_dist( pos(), pt );
3624 if( new_dist > best_dist && wont_hit_friend( pt, *used, true ) ) {
3625 best_dist = new_dist;
3626 tar = pt;
3627 }
3628 }
3629 }
3630 /* Even if tar.x/tar.y didn't get set by the above loop, throw it anyway. They
3631 * should be equal to the original location of our target, and risking friendly
3632 * fire is better than holding on to a live grenade / whatever.
3633 */
3634 npc_throw( *this, *used, weapon_index, tar );
3635 return true;
3636}
3637
3638void npc::activate_item( int item_index )
3639{
3640 const int oldmoves = moves;
3641 item &it = i_at( item_index );
3642 if( it.is_tool() || it.is_food() ) {
3643 it.type->invoke( *this, it, pos() );
3644 }
3645
3646 if( moves == oldmoves ) {
3647 // HACK: A hack to prevent debugmsgs when NPCs activate 0 move items
3648 // while not removing the debugmsgs for other 0 move actions
3649 moves--;
3650 }
3651}
3652
3653void npc::heal_player( player &patient )
3654{
3655 int dist = rl_dist( pos(), patient.pos() );
3656
3657 if( dist > 1 ) {
3658 // We need to move to the player
3659 update_path( patient.pos() );
3660 move_to_next();
3661 return;
3662 }
3663
3664 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3665 // Close enough to heal!
3666 bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( patient );
3667 if( u_see ) {
3668 add_msg( _( "%1$s heals %2$s." ), disp_name(), patient.disp_name() );
3669 }
3670
3671 item &used = get_healing_item( ai_cache.can_heal );
3672 if( used.is_null() ) {
3673 debugmsg( "%s tried to heal you but has no healing item", disp_name() );
3674 return;
3675 }
3676 if( !is_hallucination() ) {
3677 int charges_used = used.type->invoke( *this, used, patient.pos(), "heal" );
3678 consume_charges( used, charges_used );
3679 } else {
3680 pretend_heal( patient, used );
3681 }
3682
3683}
3684
3685void npc:: pretend_heal( player &patient, item used )
3686{
3687 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3688 add_msg( _( "%1$s heals %2$s." ), disp_name(),
3689 patient.disp_name() ); // you can tell that it's not real by looking at your HP though
3690 }
3691 consume_charges( used, 1 ); // empty hallucination's inventory to avoid spammming
3692 moves -= 100; // consumes moves to avoid infinite loop
3693}
3694
3695void npc::heal_self()
3696{
3697 if( has_effect( effect_asthma ) ) {
3698 item &treatment = null_item_reference();
3699 std::string iusage = "OXYGEN_BOTTLE";
3700 if( has_charges( itype_inhaler, 1 ) ) {
3701 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_inhaler ) );
3702 iusage = "INHALER";
3703 } else if( has_charges( itype_oxygen_tank, 1 ) ) {
3704 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_oxygen_tank ) );
3705 } else if( has_charges( itype_smoxygen_tank, 1 ) ) {
3706 treatment = inv.find_item( inv.position_by_type( itype_smoxygen_tank ) );
3707 }
3708 if( !treatment.is_null() ) {
3709 treatment.type->invoke( *this, treatment, pos(), iusage );
3710 consume_charges( treatment, 1 );
3711 return;
3712 }
3713 }
3714
3715 item &used = get_healing_item( ai_cache.can_heal );
3716 if( used.is_null() ) {
3717 debugmsg( "%s tried to heal self but has no healing item", disp_name() );
3718 return;
3719 }
3720
3721 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3722 add_msg( _( "%s applies a %s" ), disp_name(), used.tname() );
3723 }
3724 warn_about( "heal_self", 1_turns );
3725
3726 int charges_used = used.type->invoke( *this, used, pos(), "heal" );
3727 if( used.is_medication() ) {
3728 consume_charges( used, charges_used );
3729 }
3730}
3731
3732void npc::use_painkiller()
3733{
3734 // First, find the best painkiller for our pain level
3735 item *it = inv.most_appropriate_painkiller( get_pain() );
3736
3737 if( it->is_null() ) {
3738 debugmsg( "NPC tried to use painkillers, but has none!" );
3739 move_pause();
3740 } else {
3741 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
3742 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes some %2$s." ), disp_name(), it->tname() );
3743 }
3744 item_location loc = item_location( *this, it );
3745 consume( loc );
3746 moves = 0;
3747 }

3749
3750// We want our food to:
3751// Provide enough nutrition and quench
3752// Not provide too much of either (don't waste food)
3753// Not be unhealthy
3754// Not have side effects
3755// Be eaten before it rots (favor soon-to-rot perishables)
3756static float rate_food( const item &it, int want_nutr, int want_quench )
3757{
3758 const auto &food = it.get_comestible();
3759 if( !food ) {
3760 return 0.0f;
3761 }
3762
3763 if( food->parasites && !it.has_flag( "NO_PARASITES" ) ) {
3764 return 0.0;
3765 }
3766
3767 int nutr = food->get_default_nutr();
3768 int quench = food->quench;
3769
3770 if( nutr <= 0 && quench <= 0 ) {
3771 // Not food - may be salt, drugs etc.
3772 return 0.0f;
3773 }
3774
3775 if( !it.type->use_methods.empty() ) {
3776 // TODO: Get a good method of telling apart:
3777 // raw meat (parasites - don't eat unless mutant)
3778 // zed meat (poison - don't eat unless mutant)
3779 // alcohol (debuffs, health drop - supplement diet but don't bulk-consume)
3780 // caffeine (fine to consume, but expensive and prevents sleep)
3781 // hallucination mushrooms (NPCs don't hallucinate, so don't eat those)
3782 // honeycomb (harmless iuse)
3783 // royal jelly (way too expensive to eat as food)
3784 // mutagenic crap (don't eat, we want player to micromanage muties)
3785 // marloss (NPCs don't turn fungal)
3786 // weed brownies (small debuff)
3787 // seeds (too expensive)
3788
3789 // For now skip all of those
3790 return 0.0f;
3791 }
3792
3793 double relative_rot = it.get_relative_rot();
3794 if( relative_rot >= 1.0f ) {
3795 // TODO: Allow sapro mutants to eat it anyway and make them prefer it
3796 return 0.0f;
3797 }
3798
3799 float weight = std::max( 1.0, 10.0 * relative_rot );
3800 if( it.get_comestible_fun() < 0 ) {
3801 // This helps to avoid eating stuff like flour
3802 weight /= ( -it.get_comestible_fun() ) + 1;
3803 }
3804
3805 if( food->healthy < 0 ) {
3806 weight /= ( -food->healthy ) + 1;
3807 }
3808
3809 // Avoid wasting quench values unless it's about to rot away
3810 if( relative_rot < 0.9f && quench > want_quench ) {
3811 weight -= ( 1.0f - relative_rot ) * ( quench - want_quench );
3812 }
3813
3814 if( quench < 0 && want_quench > 0 && want_nutr < want_quench ) {
3815 // Avoid stuff that makes us thirsty when we're more thirsty than hungry
3816 weight = weight * want_nutr / want_quench;
3817 }
3818
3819 if( nutr > want_nutr ) {
3820 // TODO: Allow overeating in some cases
3821 if( nutr >= 5 ) {
3822 return 0.0f;
3823 }
3824
3825 if( relative_rot < 0.9f ) {
3826 weight /= nutr - want_nutr;
3827 }
3828 }
3829
3830 if( it.poison > 0 ) {
3831 weight -= it.poison;
3832 }
3833
3834 return weight;
3835}
3836
3837bool npc::consume_food_from_camp()
3838{
3839 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3840 return false;
3841 }
3842 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3843 cata::optional<basecamp *> potential_bc;
3844 for( const tripoint_abs_omt &camp_pos : player_character.camps ) {
3845 if( rl_dist( camp_pos, global_omt_location() ) < 3 ) {
3846 potential_bc = overmap_buffer.find_camp( camp_pos.xy() );
3847 if( potential_bc ) {
3848 break;
3849 }
3850 }
3851 }
3852 if( !potential_bc ) {
3853 return false;
3854 }
3855 basecamp *bcp = *potential_bc;
3856 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::thirsty && bcp->has_water() ) {
3857 complain_about( "camp_water_thanks", 1_hours, "<camp_water_thanks>", false );
3858 set_thirst( 0 );
3859 return true;
3860 }
3861 faction *yours = player_character.get_faction();
3862 int camp_kcals = std::min( std::max( 0, 19 * max_stored_kcal() / 20 - get_stored_kcal() -
3863 stomach.get_calories() ), yours->food_supply );
3864 if( camp_kcals > 0 ) {
3865 complain_about( "camp_food_thanks", 1_hours, "<camp_food_thanks>", false );
3866 mod_stored_kcal( camp_kcals );
3867 yours->food_supply -= camp_kcals;
3868 return true;
3869 }
3870 complain_about( "camp_larder_empty", 1_hours, "<camp_larder_empty>", false );
3871 return false;
3872}
3873
3874bool npc::consume_food()
3875{
3876 float best_weight = 0.0f;
3877 int index = -1;
3878 int want_hunger = std::max<int>( 0, ( max_stored_kcal() - get_stored_kcal() ) / 10 );
3879 int want_quench = std::max( 0, get_thirst() );
3880 invslice slice = inv.slice();
3881 for( size_t i = 0; i < slice.size(); i++ ) {
3882 const item &it = slice[i]->front();
3883 if( const item *food_item = it.get_food() ) {
3884 float cur_weight = rate_food( *food_item, want_hunger, want_quench );
3885 // Note: will_eat is expensive, avoid calling it if possible
3886 if( cur_weight > best_weight && will_eat( *food_item ).success() ) {
3887 best_weight = cur_weight;
3888 index = i;
3889 }
3890 }
3891 }
3892
3893 if( index == -1 ) {
3894 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
3895 // TODO: Remove this and let player "exploit" hungry NPCs
3896 set_stored_kcal( max_stored_kcal() );
3897 set_thirst( 0 );
3898 }
3899 return false;
3900 }
3901
3902 // consume doesn't return a meaningful answer, we need to compare moves
3903 // TODO: Make player::consume return false if it fails to consume
3904 int old_moves = moves;
3905 item_location loc = item_location( *this, &i_at( index ) );
3906 consume( loc );
3907 // TODO: a more reliable check for whether item has been consumed
3908 bool consumed = old_moves != moves;
3909 if( !consumed ) {
3910 debugmsg( "%s failed to consume %s", name, i_at( index ).tname() );
3911 }
3912
3913 return consumed;
3914}
3915
3916void npc::mug_player( Character &mark )
3917{
3918 if( mark.is_armed() ) {
3919 make_angry();
3920 }
3921
3922 if( rl_dist( pos(), mark.pos() ) > 1 ) { // We have to travel
3923 update_path( mark.pos() );
3924 move_to_next();
3925 return;
3926 }
3927
3928 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
3929 const bool u_see = player_character.sees( *this ) || player_character.sees( mark );
3930 if( mark.cash > 0 ) {
3931 if( !is_hallucination() ) { // hallucinations can't take items
3932 cash += mark.cash;
3933 mark.cash = 0;
3934 }
3935 moves = 0;
3936 // Describe the action
3937 if( mark.is_npc() ) {
3938 if( u_see ) {
3939 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes %2$s's money!" ), name, mark.name );
3940 }
3941 } else {
3942 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%s takes your money!" ), name );
3943 }
3944 return;
3945 }
3946
3947 // We already have their money; take some goodies!
3948 // value_mod affects at what point we "take the money and run"
3949 // A lower value means we'll take more stuff
3950 double value_mod = 1 - ( ( 10 - personality.bravery ) * .05 ) -
3951 ( ( 10 - personality.aggression ) * .04 ) -
3952 ( ( 10 - personality.collector ) * .06 );
3953 if( !mark.is_npc() ) {
3954 value_mod += ( op_of_u.fear * .08 );
3955 value_mod -= ( ( 8 - op_of_u.value ) * .07 );
3956 }
3957 double best_value = minimum_item_value() * value_mod;
3958 item *to_steal = nullptr;
3959 invslice slice = mark.inv.slice();
3960 for( std::list<item> *stack : slice ) {
3961 item &front_stack = stack->front();
3962 if( value( front_stack ) >= best_value &&
3963 can_pick_volume( front_stack ) &&
3964 can_pick_weight( front_stack, true ) ) {
3965 best_value = value( front_stack );
3966 to_steal = &front_stack;
3967 }
3968 }
3969 if( to_steal == nullptr ) { // Didn't find anything worthwhile!
3970 set_attitude( NPCATT_FLEE_TEMP );
3971 if( !one_in( 3 ) ) {
3972 say( "<done_mugging>" );
3973 }
3974 moves -= 100;
3975 return;
3976 }
3977 item stolen;
3978 if( !is_hallucination() ) {
3979 stolen = mark.i_rem( to_steal );
3980 i_add( stolen );
3981 }
3982 if( mark.is_npc() ) {
3983 if( u_see ) {
3984 add_msg( _( "%1$s takes %2$s's %3$s." ), name, mark.name, stolen.tname() );
3985 }
3986 } else {
3987 add_msg( m_bad, _( "%1$s takes your %2$s." ), name, stolen.tname() );
3988 }
3989 moves -= 100;
3990 if( !mark.is_npc() ) {
3991 op_of_u.value -= rng( 0, 1 ); // Decrease the value of the player
3992 }
3993}

3997 complain_about( "look_for_player", 5_minutes, "<wait>", false );

3999 move_to_next();
4000 return;

4047
4048void npc::reach_omt_destination()
4049{
4050 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4051 omt_path.clear();
4052 }
4053 map &here = get_map();
4054 if( is_travelling() ) {
4055 guard_pos = here.getabs( pos() );
4056 goal = no_goal_point;
4057 if( is_player_ally() ) {
4058 Character &player_character = get_player_character();
4059 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4060 if( rl_dist( player_character.pos(), pos() ) > SEEX * 2 || !player_character.sees( pos() ) ) {
4061 if( player_character.has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true ) &&
4062 has_item_with_flag( "TWO_WAY_RADIO", true ) ) {
4063 add_msg( m_info, _( "From your two-way radio you hear %s reporting in, "
4064 "'I've arrived, boss!'" ), disp_name() );
4065 }
4066 }
4067 } else {
4068 // for now - they just travel to a nearby place they want as a base
4069 // and chill there indefinitely, the plan is to add systems for them to build
4070 // up their base, then go out on looting missions,
4071 // then return to base afterwards.
4072 set_mission( NPC_MISSION_GUARD );
4073 if( !needs.empty() && needs[0] == need_safety ) {
4074 // we found our base.
4075 base_location = global_omt_location();
4076 }
4077 }
4078 return;
4079 }
4080 // Guarding NPCs want a specific point, not just an overmap tile
4081 // Rest stops having a goal after reaching it
4082 if( !( is_guarding() || is_patrolling() ) ) {
4083 goal = no_goal_point;
4084 return;
4085 }
4086 // If we are guarding, remember our position in case we get forcibly moved
4087 goal = global_omt_location();
4088 if( guard_pos == here.getabs( pos() ) ) {
4089 // This is the specific point
4090 return;
4091 }
4092
4093 if( path.size() > 1 ) {
4094 // No point recalculating the path to get home
4095 move_to_next();
4096 } else if( guard_pos != tripoint_min ) {
4097 update_path( here.getlocal( guard_pos ) );
4098 move_to_next();
4099 } else {
4100 guard_pos = here.getabs( pos() );
4101 }
4102}
4103
4104void npc::set_omt_destination()
4105{
4106 /* TODO: Make NPCs' movement more intelligent.
4107 * Right now this function just makes them attempt to address their needs:
4108 * if we need ammo, go to a gun store, if we need food, go to a grocery store,
4109 * and if we don't have any needs, pick a random spot.
4110 * What it SHOULD do is that, if there's time; but also look at our mission and
4111 * our faction to determine more meaningful actions, such as attacking a rival
4112 * faction's base, or meeting up with someone friendly. NPCs should also
4113 * attempt to reach safety before nightfall, and possibly similar goals.
4114 * Also, NPCs should be able to assign themselves missions like "break into that
4115 * lab" or "map that river bank."
4116 */
4117 if( is_stationary( true ) ) {
4118 guard_current_pos();
4119 return;
4120 }
4121
4122 // all of the following luxuries are at ground level.
4123 // so please wallow in hunger & fear if below ground.
4124 if( posz() != 0 && !get_map().has_zlevels() ) {
4125 goal = no_goal_point;
4126 return;
4127 }
4128
4129 tripoint_abs_omt surface_omt_loc = global_omt_location();
4130 // We need that, otherwise find_closest won't work properly
4131 surface_omt_loc.z() = 0;
4132
4133 // also, don't bother looking if the CITY_SIZE is 0, just go somewhere at random
4134 const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4135 if( city_size == 0 ) {
4136 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4137 return;
4138 }
4139
4140 decide_needs();
4141 if( needs.empty() ) { // We don't need anything in particular.
4142 needs.push_back( need_none );
4143 }
4144
4145 std::string dest_type;
4146 for( const auto &fulfill : needs ) {
4147 // look for the closest occurence of any of that locations terrain types
4148 std::vector<oter_type_id> loc_list = get_location_for( fulfill )->get_all_terrains();
4149 std::shuffle( loc_list.begin(), loc_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4150 omt_find_params find_params;
4151 std::vector<std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type>> temp_types;
4152 for( const oter_type_id &elem : loc_list ) {
4153 std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type> temp_pair;
4154 temp_pair.first = elem.id().str();
4155 temp_pair.second = ot_match_type::type;
4156 temp_types.push_back( temp_pair );
4157 }
4158 find_params.search_range = 75;
4159 find_params.min_distance = 0;
4160 find_params.must_see = false;
4161 find_params.cant_see = false;
4162 find_params.types = temp_types;
4163 find_params.existing_only = false;
4164 goal = overmap_buffer.find_closest( surface_omt_loc, find_params );
4165 omt_path.clear();
4166 if( goal != overmap::invalid_tripoint ) {
4167 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4168 }
4169 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4170 break;
4171 }
4172 }
4173
4174 // couldn't find any places to go, so go somewhere.
4175 if( goal == overmap::invalid_tripoint || omt_path.empty() ) {
4176 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4177 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4178 // try one more time
4179 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4180 goal = surface_omt_loc + point( rng( -90, 90 ), rng( -90, 90 ) );
4181 omt_path = overmap_buffer.get_travel_path( surface_omt_loc, goal, overmap_path_params::for_npc() );
4182 }
4183 if( omt_path.empty() ) {
4184 goal = no_goal_point;
4185 }
4186 return;
4187 }
4188
4189 DebugLog( DL::Info, DC::Main ) << "npc::set_omt_destination - new goal for NPC [" << get_name()
4190 << "] with [" << get_need_str_id( needs.front() )
4191 << "] is [" << dest_type << "] in " << goal.to_string() << ".";
4192}
4193
4194void npc::go_to_omt_destination()
4195{
4196 map &here = get_map();
4197 if( ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4198 if( here.getabs( pos() ) == *ai_cache.guard_pos ) {
4199 path.clear();
4200 ai_cache.guard_pos = cata::nullopt;
4201 move_pause();
4202 return;
4203 }
4204 }
4205 if( goal == no_goal_point || omt_path.empty() ) {
4206 add_msg( m_debug, "npc::go_to_destination with no goal" );
4207 move_pause();
4208 reach_omt_destination();
4209 return;
4210 }
4211 const tripoint_abs_omt omt_pos = global_omt_location();
4212 if( goal == omt_pos ) {
4213 // We're at our desired map square! Pause to keep the NPC infinite loop counter happy
4214 move_pause();
4215 reach_omt_destination();
4216 return;
4217 }
4218 if( !path.empty() ) {
4219 // we already have a path, just use that until we can't.
4220 move_to_next();
4221 return;
4222 }
4223 // get the next path point
4224 if( omt_path.back() == omt_pos ) {
4225 // this should be the square we are at.
4226 omt_path.pop_back();
4227 }
4228 if( !omt_path.empty() ) {
4229 point_rel_omt omt_diff = omt_path.back().xy() - omt_pos.xy();
4230 if( omt_diff.x() > 3 || omt_diff.x() < -3 || omt_diff.y() > 3 || omt_diff.y() < -3 ) {
4231 // we've gone wandering somehow, reset destination.
4232 if( !is_player_ally() ) {
4233 set_omt_destination();
4234 } else {
4235 talk_function::assign_guard( *this );
4236 }
4237 return;
4238 }
4239 }
4240 // TODO: fix point types
4241 tripoint sm_tri =
4242 here.getlocal( project_to<coords::ms>( omt_path.back() ).raw() );
4243 tripoint centre_sub = sm_tri + point( SEEX, SEEY );
4244 if( !here.passable( centre_sub ) ) {
4245 auto candidates = here.points_in_radius( centre_sub, 2 );
4246 for( const auto &elem : candidates ) {
4247 if( here.passable( elem ) ) {
4248 centre_sub = elem;
4249 break;
4250 }
4251 }
4252 }
4253 path = here.route( pos(), centre_sub, get_pathfinding_settings(), get_path_avoid() );
4254 add_msg( m_debug, "%s going %s->%s", name, omt_pos.to_string(), goal.to_string() );
4255
4256 if( !path.empty() ) {
4257 move_to_next();
4258 return;
4259 }
4260 move_pause();
4261}
4262
4263void npc::guard_current_pos()
4264{
4265 goal = global_omt_location();
4266 guard_pos = get_map().getabs( pos() );
4267}

4362// Maybe TODO: Move to Character method and use map methods
4363static body_part bp_affected( npc &who, const efftype_id &effect_type )
4364{
4365 body_part ret = num_bp;
4366 int highest_intensity = INT_MIN;
4367 for( const body_part bp : all_body_parts ) {
4368 const auto &eff = who.get_effect( effect_type, bp );
4369 if( !eff.is_null() && eff.get_intensity() > highest_intensity ) {
4370 ret = bp;
4371 highest_intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4372 }
4373 }
4374
4375 return ret;
4376}

4391void npc::warn_about( const std::string &type, const time_duration &d, const std::string &name,
4392 int range, const tripoint &danger_pos )
4393{
4394 std::string snip;
4395 sounds::sound_t spriority = sounds::sound_t::alert;
4396 if( type == "monster" ) {
4397 snip = is_enemy() ? "<monster_warning_h>" : "<monster_warning>";
4398 } else if( type == "explosion" ) {
4399 snip = is_enemy() ? "<fire_in_the_hole_h>" : "<fire_in_the_hole>";
4400 } else if( type == "general_danger" ) {
4401 snip = is_enemy() ? "<general_danger_h>" : "<general_danger>";
4402 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4403 } else if( type == "relax" ) {
4404 snip = is_enemy() ? "<its_safe_h>" : "<its_safe>";
4405 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4406 } else if( type == "kill_npc" ) {
4407 snip = is_enemy() ? "<kill_npc_h>" : "<kill_npc>";
4408 } else if( type == "kill_player" ) {
4409 snip = is_enemy() ? "<kill_player_h>" : "";
4410 } else if( type == "run_away" ) {
4411 snip = "<run_away>";
4412 } else if( type == "cant_flee" ) {
4413 snip = "<cant_flee>";
4414 } else if( type == "fire_bad" ) {
4415 snip = "<fire_bad>";
4416 } else if( type == "speech_noise" ) {
4417 snip = "<speech_warning>";
4418 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4419 } else if( type == "combat_noise" ) {
4420 snip = "<combat_noise_warning>";
4421 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4422 } else if( type == "movement_noise" ) {
4423 snip = "<movement_noise_warning>";
4424 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4425 } else if( type == "heal_self" ) {
4426 snip = "<heal_self>";
4427 spriority = sounds::sound_t::speech;
4428 } else {
4429 return;
4430 }
4431 const std::string warning_name = "warning_" + type + name;
4432 if( name.empty() ) {
4433 complain_about( warning_name, d, snip, is_enemy(), spriority );
4434 } else {
4435 const std::string range_str = range < 1 ? "<punc>" :
4436 string_format( _( " %s, %s" ),
4437 direction_name( direction_from( pos(), danger_pos ) ),
4438 distance_string( range ) );
4439 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "%s %s%s" ), snip, name, range_str );
4440 complain_about( warning_name, d, speech, is_enemy(), spriority );
4441 }
4442}
4443
4444bool npc::complain_about( const std::string &issue, const time_duration &dur,
4445 const std::string &speech, const bool force, const sounds::sound_t priority )
4446{
4447 // Don't have a default constructor for time_point, so accessing it in the
4448 // complaints map is a bit difficult, those lambdas should cover it.
4449 const auto complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key, const time_duration & d ) {
4450 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4451 return iter == complaints.end() || iter->second < calendar::turn - d;
4452 };
4453 const auto set_complain_since = [this]( const std::string & key ) {
4454 const auto iter = complaints.find( key );
4455 if( iter == complaints.end() ) {
4456 complaints.emplace( key, calendar::turn );
4457 } else {
4458 iter->second = calendar::turn;
4459 }
4460 };
4461
4462 // Don't wake player up with non-serious complaints
4463 // Stop complaining while asleep
4464 const bool do_complain = force || ( rules.has_flag( ally_rule::allow_complain ) &&
4465 !get_player_character().in_sleep_state() && !in_sleep_state() );
4466
4467 if( complain_since( issue, dur ) && do_complain ) {
4468 say( speech, priority );
4469 set_complain_since( issue );
4470 return true;
4471 }
4472 return false;
4473}
4474
4475bool npc::complain()
4476{
4477 static const std::string infected_string = "infected";
4478 static const std::string fatigue_string = "fatigue";
4479 static const std::string bite_string = "bite";
4480 static const std::string bleed_string = "bleed";
4481 static const std::string radiation_string = "radiation";
4482 static const std::string hunger_string = "hunger";
4483 static const std::string thirst_string = "thirst";
4484
4485 if( !is_player_ally() || !get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4486 return false;
4487 }
4488
4489 // When infected, complain every (4-intensity) hours
4490 // At intensity 3, ignore player wanting us to shut up
4491 if( has_effect( effect_infected ) ) {
4492 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_infected );
4493 const auto &eff = get_effect( effect_infected, bp );
4494 int intensity = eff.get_intensity();
4495 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s wound is infected" ),
4496 body_part_name( bp ) );
4497 if( complain_about( infected_string, time_duration::from_hours( 4 - intensity ), speech,
4498 intensity >= 3 ) ) {
4499 // Only one complaint per turn
4500 return true;
4501 }
4502 }
4503
4504 // When bitten, complain every hour, but respect restrictions
4505 if( has_effect( effect_bite ) ) {
4506 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bite );
4507 const std::string speech = string_format( _( "The bite wound on my %s looks bad." ),
4508 body_part_name( bp ) );
4509 if( complain_about( bite_string, 1_hours, speech ) ) {
4510 return true;
4511 }
4512 }
4513
4514 // When tired, complain every 30 minutes
4515 // If massively tired, ignore restrictions
4516 if( get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::tired &&
4517 complain_about( fatigue_string, 30_minutes, _( "<yawn>" ),
4518 get_fatigue() > fatigue_levels::massive - 100 ) ) {
4519 return true;
4520 }
4521
4522 // Radiation every 10 minutes
4523 if( get_rad() > 90 ) {
4524 activate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4525 std::string speech = _( "I'm suffering from radiation sickness" );
4526 if( complain_about( radiation_string, 10_minutes, speech, get_rad() > 150 ) ) {
4527 return true;
4528 }
4529 } else if( !get_rad() ) {
4530 deactivate_bionic_by_id( bio_radscrubber );
4531 }
4532
4533 // Hunger every 3-6 hours
4534 // Since NPCs can't starve to death, respect the rules
4535 if( get_kcal_percent() < 0.9 &&
4536 complain_about( hunger_string, std::max( 3_hours,
4537 time_duration::from_minutes( get_kcal_percent() * 60 * 7 ) ), _( "<hungry>" ) ) ) {
4538 return true;
4539 }
4540
4541 // Thirst every 2 hours
4542 // Since NPCs can't dry to death, respect the rules
4543 if( get_thirst() > thirst_levels::very_thirsty &&
4544 complain_about( thirst_string, 2_hours, _( "<thirsty>" ) ) ) {
4545 return true;
4546 }
4547
4548 //Bleeding every 5 minutes
4549 if( has_effect( effect_bleed ) ) {
4550 body_part bp = bp_affected( *this, effect_bleed );
4551 std::string speech = string_format( _( "My %s is bleeding!" ), body_part_name( bp ) );
4552 if( complain_about( bleed_string, 5_minutes, speech ) ) {
4553 return true;
4554 }
4555 }
4556
4557 return false;
4558}
4559
4560void npc::do_reload( const item &it )
4561{
4562 item_reload_option reload_opt = character_funcs::select_ammo( *this, it );
4563
4564 if( !reload_opt ) {
4565 debugmsg( "do_reload failed: no usable ammo for %s", it.tname() );
4566 return;
4567 }
4568
4569 // Note: we may be reloading the magazine inside, not the gun itself
4570 // Maybe TODO: allow reload functions to understand such reloads instead of const casts
4571 item &target = const_cast<item &>( *reload_opt.target );
4572 item_location &usable_ammo = reload_opt.ammo;
4573
4574 int qty = std::max( 1, std::min( usable_ammo->charges,
4575 it.ammo_capacity() - it.ammo_remaining() ) );
4576 int reload_time = item_reload_cost( it, *usable_ammo, qty );
4577 // TODO: Consider printing this info to player too
4578 const std::string ammo_name = usable_ammo->tname();
4579 if( !target.reload( *this, std::move( usable_ammo ), qty ) ) {
4580 debugmsg( "do_reload failed: item %s could not be reloaded with %ld charge(s) of %s",
4581 it.tname(), qty, ammo_name );
4582 return;
4583 }
4584
4585 moves -= reload_time;
4586 recoil = MAX_RECOIL;
4587
4588 if( get_player_character().sees( *this ) ) {
4589 add_msg( _( "%1$s reloads their %2$s." ), name, it.tname() );
4590 sfx::play_variant_sound( "reload", it.typeId().str(), sfx::get_heard_volume( pos() ),
4591 sfx::get_heard_angle( pos() ) );
4592 }
4593
4594 // Otherwise the NPC may not equip the weapon until they see danger
4595 has_new_items = true;
4596}
4597
4598bool npc::adjust_worn()
4599{
4600 bool any_broken = false;
4601 for( const bodypart_id &bp : get_all_body_parts() ) {
4602 if( is_limb_broken( bp ) ) {
4603 any_broken = true;
4604 break;
4605 }
4606 }
4607
4608 if( !any_broken ) {
4609 return false;
4610 }
4611 const auto covers_broken = [this]( const item & it, side s ) {
4612 const body_part_set covered = it.get_covered_body_parts( s );
4613 for( const std::pair<const bodypart_str_id, bodypart> &elem : get_body() ) {
4614 if( elem.second.get_hp_cur() <= 0 && covered.test( elem.first->token ) ) {
4615 return true;
4616 }
4617 }
4618 return false;
4619 };
4620
4621 for( auto &elem : worn ) {
4622 if( !elem.has_flag( "SPLINT" ) ) {
4623 continue;
4624 }
4625
4626 if( !covers_broken( elem, elem.get_side() ) ) {
4627 const bool needs_change = covers_broken( elem, opposite_side( elem.get_side() ) );
4628 // Try to change side (if it makes sense), or take off.
4629 if( ( needs_change && change_side( elem ) ) || takeoff( elem ) ) {
4630 return true;
4631 }
4632 }
4633 }
4634
4635 return false;
4636}
